   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   28: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   29: 
   30: -export([tick/1, tick_intensity/1, tick_change/1,
   31:          connect_node/1,
   32:          nodenames/1, hostnames/1,
   33:          illegal_nodenames/1, hidden_node/1,
   34:          dyn_node_name/1,
   35:          epmd_reconnect/1,
   36: 	 setopts/1,
   37: 	 table_waste/1, net_setuptime/1,
   38: 	 inet_dist_options_options/1,
   39:          net_ticker_spawn_options/1,
   40: 
   41: 	 monitor_nodes_nodedown_reason/1,
   42: 	 monitor_nodes_complex_nodedown_reason/1,
   43: 	 monitor_nodes_node_type/1,
   44: 	 monitor_nodes_misc/1,
   45: 	 monitor_nodes_otp_6481/1,
   46: 	 monitor_nodes_errors/1,
   47: 	 monitor_nodes_combinations/1,
   48: 	 monitor_nodes_cleanup/1,
   49: 	 monitor_nodes_many/1,
   50:          monitor_nodes_down_up/1,
   51:          dist_ctrl_proc_smoke/1,
   52:          dist_ctrl_proc_reject/1,
   53:          erl_uds_dist_smoke_test/1,
   54:          erl_1424/1, net_kernel_start/1, differing_cookies/1,
   55:          cmdline_setcookie_2/1, connection_cookie/1,
   56:          dyn_differing_cookies/1,
   57:          xdg_cookie/1]).
   58: 
   59: %% Performs the test at another node.
   60: -export([get_socket_priorities/0,
   61:          get_net_ticker_fullsweep_option/1,
   62: 	 tick_cli_test/3, tick_cli_test1/3,
   63: 	 tick_serv_test/2, tick_serv_test1/1,
   64: 	 run_remote_test/1,
   65:          dyn_node_name_do/2,
   66:          epmd_reconnect_do/2,
   67: 	 setopts_do/2,
   68:          setopts_deadlock_test/2,
   69: 	 keep_conn/1, time_ping/1,
   70:          ddc_remote_run/2]).
   71: 
   72: -export([net_kernel_start_do_test/1]).
   73: 
   74: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   75: 
   76: -export([dist_cntrlr_output_test_size/2]).
   77: 
   78: -export([pinger/1]).
   79: 
   80: -export([start_uds_rpc_server/1]).
   81: 
   82: -define(DUMMY_NODE,dummy@test01).
   83: -define(ALT_EPMD_PORT, "12321").
   84: -define(ALT_EPMD_CMD, "epmd -port "++?ALT_EPMD_PORT).
   85: 
   86: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   87: %% The distribution is mainly tested in the big old test_suite.
   88: %% This test only tests the net_ticktime configuration flag.
   89: %% Should be started in a CC view with:
   90: %% erl -sname master -rsh ctrsh
   91: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   92: 
   93: suite() ->
   94:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   95:      {timetrap,{minutes,12}}].
   96: 
   97: all() -> 
   98:     [dist_ctrl_proc_smoke,
   99:      dist_ctrl_proc_reject,
  100:      tick, tick_intensity, tick_change, nodenames, hostnames,
  101:      illegal_nodenames, connect_node,
  102:      dyn_node_name,
  103:      epmd_reconnect,
  104:      hidden_node, setopts,
  105:      table_waste, net_setuptime, inet_dist_options_options,
  106:      net_ticker_spawn_options,
  107:      {group, monitor_nodes},
  108:      erl_uds_dist_smoke_test,
  109:      erl_1424, net_kernel_start,
  110:      {group, differing_cookies}].
  111: 
  112: groups() -> 
  113:     [{monitor_nodes, [],
  114:       [monitor_nodes_nodedown_reason,
  115:        monitor_nodes_complex_nodedown_reason,
  116:        monitor_nodes_node_type, monitor_nodes_misc,
  117:        monitor_nodes_otp_6481, monitor_nodes_errors,
  118:        monitor_nodes_combinations, monitor_nodes_cleanup,
  119:        monitor_nodes_many,
  120:        monitor_nodes_down_up]},
  121:      {differing_cookies, [],
  122:       [differing_cookies,
  123:        cmdline_setcookie_2,
  124:        connection_cookie,
  125:        dyn_differing_cookies,
  126:        xdg_cookie]}].
  127: 
  128: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  129:     start_gen_tcp_dist_test_type_server(),
  130:     Config.
  131: 
  132: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  133:     [slave:stop(N) || N <- nodes()],
  134:     kill_gen_tcp_dist_test_type_server(),
  135:     ok.
  136: 
  137: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  138:     Config.
  139: 
  140: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  141:     Config.
  142: 
  143: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == hostnames;
  144:                                    TC == nodenames ->
  145:     file:make_dir("hostnames_nodedir"),
  146:     file:write_file("hostnames_nodedir/ignore_core_files",""),
  147:     Config;
  148: init_per_testcase(epmd_reconnect, Config) ->
  149:     [] = os:cmd(?ALT_EPMD_CMD++" -relaxed_command_check -daemon"),
  150:     Config;
  151: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
  152:     Config.
  153: 
  154: end_per_testcase(epmd_reconnect, _Config) ->
  155:     os:cmd(?ALT_EPMD_CMD++" -kill"),
  156:     ok;
  157: end_per_testcase(_Func, _Config) ->
  158:     ok.
  159: 
  160: connect_node(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  161:     Connected = nodes(connected),
  162:     true = net_kernel:connect_node(node()),
  163:     Connected = nodes(connected),
  164:     ok.
  165: 
  166: tick(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  167:     run_dist_configs(fun tick/2, Config).
  168: 
  169: tick(DCfg, Config) ->
  170:     tick_test(DCfg, Config, false).
  171: 
  172: tick_intensity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  173:     run_dist_configs(fun tick_intensity/2, Config).
  174: 
  175: tick_intensity(DCfg, Config) ->
  176:     tick_test(DCfg, Config, true).
  177: 
  178: tick_test(DCfg, _Config, CheckIntensityArg) ->
  179:     %%
  180:     %% This test case use disabled "connect all" so that
  181:     %% global wont interfere...
  182:     %%
  183: 
  184:     [Name1, Name2] = get_nodenames(2, dist_test),
  185: 
  186:     {ok, Node} = start_node(DCfg, Name1),
  187: 
  188:     case CheckIntensityArg of
  189:         true ->
  190:             %% Not for intensity test...
  191:             ok;
  192:         false ->
  193:             %% First check that the normal case is OK!
  194:             rpc:call(Node, erl_distribution_SUITE, tick_cli_test, [node(), 8000, 16000]),
  195: 
  196:             erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  197:             receive
  198:                 {nodedown, Node} ->
  199:                     ct:fail("nodedown from other node")
  200:             after 30000 ->
  201:                     erlang:monitor_node(Node, false)
  202:             end,
  203:             ok
  204:     end,
  205: 
  206:     stop_node(Node),
  207: 
  208:     %% Now, set the net_ticktime for the other node to 12 secs.
  209:     %% After the sleep(2sec) and cast the other node shall destroy
  210:     %% the connection as it has not received anything on the connection.
  211:     %% The nodedown message should arrive within 8 < T < 16 secs.
  212: 
  213:     %% We must have two slave nodes as the slave mechanism otherwise
  214:     %% halts the client node after tick timeout (the connection is down
  215:     %% and the slave node decides to halt !!
  216: 
  217:     %% Set the ticktime on the server node to 100 secs so the server
  218:     %% node doesn't tick the client node within the interval ...
  219: 
  220:     {ok, ServNode} = start_node(DCfg, Name2,
  221: 				"-kernel net_ticktime 100 -connect_all false"),
  222:     rpc:call(ServNode, erl_distribution_SUITE, tick_serv_test, [Node, node()]),
  223: 
  224:     %% We set min/max a second lower/higher than expected since it takes
  225:     %% time for termination of the dist controller, delivery of messages,
  226:     %% scheduling of the process receiving nodedown, etc...
  227:     {IArg, Min, Max} = case CheckIntensityArg of
  228:                            false ->
  229:                                {"", 7000, 17000};
  230:                            true ->
  231:                                {" -kernel net_tickintensity 24", 10500, 13500}
  232:                        end,
  233:     
  234:     {ok, Node} = start_node(DCfg, Name1,
  235:                             "-kernel net_ticktime 12 -connect_all false" ++ IArg),
  236: 
  237:     rpc:call(Node, erl_distribution_SUITE, tick_cli_test, [ServNode, Min, Max]),
  238: 
  239:     spawn_link(erl_distribution_SUITE, keep_conn, [Node]),
  240: 
  241:     {tick_serv, ServNode} ! {i_want_the_result, self()},
  242: 
  243:     monitor_node(ServNode, true),
  244:     monitor_node(Node, true),
  245: 
  246:     receive
  247: 	{tick_test, T} when is_integer(T) ->
  248: 	    stop_node(ServNode),
  249: 	    stop_node(Node),
  250:             io:format("Result: ~p~n", [T]),
  251: 	    T;
  252: 	{tick_test, Error} ->
  253: 	    stop_node(ServNode),
  254: 	    stop_node(Node),
  255: 	    ct:fail(Error);
  256: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  257: 	    stop_node(ServNode),
  258: 	    ct:fail("client node died");
  259: 	{nodedown, ServNode} ->
  260: 	    stop_node(Node),
  261: 	    ct:fail("server node died")
  262:     end,
  263:     ok.
  264: 
  265: %% Checks that pinging nonexistyent nodes does not waste space in distribution table.
  266: table_waste(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  267:     run_dist_configs(fun table_waste/2, Config).
  268: 
  269: table_waste(DCfg, _Config) ->
  270:     {ok, HName} = inet:gethostname(),
  271:     F = fun(0,_F) -> [];
  272: 	   (N,F) -> 
  273: 		Name = list_to_atom("erl_distribution_"++integer_to_list(N)++
  274: 					"@"++HName),
  275: 		pang = net_adm:ping(Name),
  276: 		F(N-1,F)
  277: 	end,
  278:     F(256,F),
  279:     {ok, N} = start_node(DCfg, erl_distribution_300),
  280:     stop_node(N),
  281:     ok.
  282: 
  283: %% Test that starting nodes with different legal name part works, and that illegal
  284: %% ones are filtered
  285: nodenames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  286:     legal("a1@b"),
  287:     legal("a-1@b"),
  288:     legal("a_1@b"),
  289: 
  290:     %% Test that giving two -sname works as it should
  291:     started = test_node("a_1@b", false, long_or_short() ++ "a_0@b"),
  292: 
  293:     illegal("cdé@a"),
  294:     illegal("te欢st@a").
  295: 
  296: %% Test that starting nodes with different legal host part works, and that illegal
  297: %% ones are filtered
  298: hostnames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  299:     Host = gethostname(),
  300:     legal([$a,$@|atom_to_list(Host)]),
  301:     legal("1@b1"),
  302:     legal("b@b1-c"),
  303:     legal("c@b1_c"),
  304:     legal("d@b1#c"),
  305:     legal("f@::1"),
  306:     legal("g@1:bc3:4e3f:f20:0:1"),
  307: 
  308:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
  309:         latin1 -> ignore;
  310:         _ -> legal("e@b1é")
  311:     end,
  312:     long_hostnames(net_kernel:longnames()),
  313: 
  314:     illegal("h@testالع"),
  315:     illegal("i@языtest"),
  316:     illegal("j@te欢st").
  317: 
  318: long_hostnames(true) ->
  319:     legal("k@b.b.c"),
  320:     legal("l@b.b-c.d"),
  321:     legal("m@b.b_c.d"),
  322:     legal("n@127.0.0.1"),
  323:     legal("o@207.123.456.789");
  324: long_hostnames(false) ->
  325:     illegal("k@b.b.c").
  326: 
  327: legal(Name) ->
  328:     case test_node(Name) of
  329:         started ->
  330:             ok;
  331:         not_started ->
  332:             ct:fail("no ~p node started", [Name])
  333:     end.
  334: 
  335: illegal(Name) ->
  336:     case test_node(Name, true) of
  337:         not_started ->
  338:             ok;
  339:         started ->
  340:             ct:fail("~p node started with illegal name", [Name])
  341:     end.
  342: 
  343: test_node(Name) ->
  344:     test_node(Name, false).
  345: test_node(Name, Illegal) ->
  346:     test_node(Name, Illegal, "").
  347: test_node(Name, Illegal, ExtraArgs) ->
  348:     ProgName = ct:get_progname(),
  349:     Command = ProgName ++ " -noinput " ++
  350:         long_or_short() ++ Name ++ ExtraArgs ++
  351:         " -eval \"net_adm:ping('" ++ atom_to_list(node()) ++ "')\"" ++
  352:         case Illegal of
  353:             true ->
  354:                 " -eval \"timer:sleep(10000),init:stop().\"";
  355:             false ->
  356:                 ""
  357:         end,
  358:     net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true),
  359:     BinCommand = unicode:characters_to_binary(Command, utf8),
  360:     _Prt = open_port({spawn, BinCommand}, [stream,{cd,"hostnames_nodedir"}]),
  361:     Node = list_to_atom(Name),
  362:     receive
  363:         {nodeup, Node} ->
  364:             net_kernel:monitor_nodes(false),
  365:             slave:stop(Node),
  366:             started
  367:     after 5000 ->
  368:         net_kernel:monitor_nodes(false),
  369:         not_started
  370:     end.
  371: 
  372: long_or_short() ->
  373:     case net_kernel:longnames() of
  374:         true -> " -name ";
  375:         false -> " -sname "
  376:     end.
  377: 
  378: % get the localhost's name, depending on the using name policy
  379: gethostname() ->
  380:     Hostname = case net_kernel:longnames() of
  381:        true->
  382:            net_adm:localhost();
  383:        _->
  384:            {ok, Name}=inet:gethostname(),
  385:            Name
  386:     end,
  387:     list_to_atom(Hostname).
  388: 
  389: %% Test that pinging an illegal nodename does not kill the node.
  390: illegal_nodenames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  391:     run_dist_configs(fun illegal_nodenames/2, Config).
  392: 
  393: illegal_nodenames(DCfg, _Config) ->
  394:     {ok, Node}=start_node(DCfg, illegal_nodenames),
  395:     monitor_node(Node, true),
  396:     RPid=rpc:call(Node, erlang, spawn,
  397: 		  [?MODULE, pinger, [self()]]),
  398:     receive
  399: 	{RPid, pinged} ->
  400:             monitor_node(Node, false),
  401: 	    ok;
  402: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  403: 	    ct:fail("Remote node died.")
  404:     end,
  405:     stop_node(Node),
  406:     ok.
  407: 
  408: pinger(Starter) ->
  409:     io:format("Starter:~p~n",[Starter]),
  410:     net_adm:ping(a@b@c),
  411:     Starter ! {self(), pinged},
  412:     ok.
  413: 
  414: 
  415: %% Test that you can set the net_setuptime properly.
  416: net_setuptime(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  417:     run_dist_configs(fun net_setuptime/2, Config).
  418: 
  419: net_setuptime(DCfg, _Config) ->
  420: 
  421:     %% In this test case, we reluctantly accept shorter times than the given
  422:     %% setup time, because the connection attempt can end in a
  423:     %% "Host unreachable" error before the timeout fires.
  424: 
  425:     Res0 = do_test_setuptime(DCfg, "2"),
  426:     io:format("Res0 = ~p", [Res0]),
  427:     true = (Res0 =< 4000),
  428:     Res1 = do_test_setuptime(DCfg, "0.3"),
  429:     io:format("Res1 = ~p", [Res1]),
  430:     true = (Res1 =< 500),
  431:     ok.
  432: 
  433: do_test_setuptime(DCfg, Setuptime) when is_list(Setuptime) ->
  434:     {ok, Node} = start_node(DCfg, dist_setuptime_test,
  435:                             "-kernel net_setuptime " ++ Setuptime),
  436:     Res = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,time_ping,[?DUMMY_NODE]),
  437:     stop_node(Node),
  438:     Res.
  439: 
  440: time_ping(Node) ->
  441:     T0 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  442:     pang = net_adm:ping(Node),
  443:     T1 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  444:     erlang:convert_time_unit(T1 - T0, native, millisecond).
  445: 
  446: %% Keep the connection with the client node up.
  447: %% This is necessary as the client node runs with much shorter
  448: %% tick time !!
  449: keep_conn(Node) ->
  450:     sleep(1),
  451:     rpc:cast(Node, erlang, time, []),
  452:     keep_conn(Node).
  453: 
  454: tick_serv_test(Node, MasterNode) ->
  455:     spawn(erl_distribution_SUITE, keep_conn, [MasterNode]),
  456:     spawn(erl_distribution_SUITE, tick_serv_test1, [Node]).
  457: 
  458: tick_serv_test1(Node) ->
  459:     register(tick_serv, self()),
  460:     TestServer = receive {i_want_the_result, TS} -> TS end,
  461:     monitor_node(Node, true),
  462:     receive
  463: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  464: 	    net_adm:ping(Node), %% Set up the connection again !!
  465: 
  466: 	    {tick_test, Node} ! {whats_the_result, self()},
  467: 	    receive
  468: 		{tick_test, Res} ->
  469: 		    TestServer ! {tick_test, Res}
  470: 	    end
  471:     end.
  472: 
  473: tick_cli_test(Node, Min, Max) ->
  474:     spawn(erl_distribution_SUITE, tick_cli_test1, [Node, Min, Max]).
  475: 
  476: tick_cli_test1(Node, Min, Max) ->
  477:     register(tick_test, self()),
  478:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  479:     sleep(2),
  480:     rpc:call(Node, erlang, time, []), %% simulate action on the connection
  481:     T1 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  482:     receive
  483: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  484: 	    T2 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  485: 	    receive
  486: 		{whats_the_result, From} ->
  487: 		    Diff = erlang:convert_time_unit(T2-T1, native,
  488: 						    millisecond),
  489: 		    case Diff of
  490: 			T when Min =< T, T =< Max ->
  491: 			    From ! {tick_test, T};
  492: 			T ->
  493: 			    From ! {tick_test,
  494: 				    {"T not in interval "
  495:                                      ++ integer_to_list(Min)
  496:                                      ++ " =< T =< "
  497:                                      ++ integer_to_list(Max),
  498: 				     T}}
  499: 		    end
  500: 	    end
  501:     end.
  502: 
  503: epmd_reconnect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  504:     NodeNames = [N1,N2,N3] = get_nodenames(3, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  505:     Nodes = [atom_to_list(full_node_name(NN)) || NN <- NodeNames],
  506: 
  507:     DCfg = "-epmd_port "++?ALT_EPMD_PORT,
  508: 
  509:     {_N1F,Port1} = start_node_unconnected(DCfg, N1, ?MODULE, run_remote_test,
  510: 					["epmd_reconnect_do", atom_to_list(node()), "1" | Nodes]),
  511:     {_N2F,Port2} = start_node_unconnected(DCfg, N2, ?MODULE, run_remote_test,
  512: 					["epmd_reconnect_do", atom_to_list(node()), "2" | Nodes]),
  513:     {_N3F,Port3} = start_node_unconnected(DCfg, N3, ?MODULE, run_remote_test,
  514: 					["epmd_reconnect_do", atom_to_list(node()), "3" | Nodes]),
  515:     Ports = [Port1, Port2, Port3],
  516: 
  517:     ok = reap_ports(Ports),
  518:    
  519:     ok.
  520: 
  521: reap_ports([]) ->
  522:     ok;
  523: reap_ports(Ports) ->
  524:     case (receive M -> M end) of
  525: 	{Port, Message} ->
  526:             case lists:member(Port, Ports) andalso Message of
  527:                 {data,String} ->
  528:                     io:format("~p: ~s\n", [Port, String]),
  529:                     reap_ports(Ports);
  530:                 {exit_status,0} ->
  531:                     reap_ports(Ports -- [Port])
  532:             end
  533:     end.
  534:     
  535: epmd_reconnect_do(_Node, ["1", Node1, Node2, Node3]) ->
  536:     Names = [Name || Name <- [hd(string:tokens(Node, "@")) || Node <- [Node1, Node2, Node3]]],
  537:     %% wait until all nodes are registered
  538:     ok = wait_for_names(Names),
  539:     "Killed" ++_ = os:cmd(?ALT_EPMD_CMD++" -kill"),
  540:     open_port({spawn, ?ALT_EPMD_CMD}, []),
  541:     %% check that all nodes reregister with epmd
  542:     ok = wait_for_names(Names),
  543:     lists:foreach(fun(Node) ->
  544:                           ANode = list_to_atom(Node),
  545:                           pong = net_adm:ping(ANode),
  546:                           {epmd_reconnect_do, ANode} ! {stop, Node1, Node}
  547:                   end, [Node2, Node3]),
  548:     ok;
  549: epmd_reconnect_do(_Node, ["2", Node1, Node2, _Node3]) ->
  550:     register(epmd_reconnect_do, self()),
  551:     receive {stop, Node1, Node2} ->
  552:             ok
  553:     after 7000 ->
  554:             exit(timeout)
  555:     end;
  556: epmd_reconnect_do(_Node, ["3", Node1, _Node2, Node3]) ->
  557:     register(epmd_reconnect_do, self()),
  558:     receive {stop, Node1, Node3} ->
  559:             ok
  560:     after 7000 ->
  561:             exit(timeout)
  562:     end.
  563: 
  564: wait_for_names(Names) ->
  565:     %% wait for up to 3 seconds (the current retry timer in erl_epmd is 2s)
  566:     wait_for_names(lists:sort(Names), 30, 100).
  567: 
  568: wait_for_names(Names, N, Wait) when N > 0 ->
  569:     try
  570:         {ok, Info} = erl_epmd:names(),
  571:         Names = lists:sort([Name || {Name, _Port} <- Info]),
  572:         ok
  573:     catch
  574:         error:{badmatch, _} ->
  575:             timer:sleep(Wait),
  576:             wait_for_names(Names, N-1, Wait)
  577:     end.
  578: 
  579: 
  580: dyn_node_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  581:     run_dist_configs(fun dyn_node_name/2, Config).
  582: 
  583: dyn_node_name(DCfg, _Config) ->
  584:     NameDomain = case net_kernel:get_state() of
  585:                      #{name_domain := shortnames} -> "shortnames";
  586:                      #{name_domain := longnames} -> "longnames"
  587:                  end,
  588:     {_N1F,Port1} = start_node_unconnected(DCfg,
  589:                                           undefined, ?MODULE, run_remote_test,
  590:                                           ["dyn_node_name_do", atom_to_list(node()),
  591:                                            NameDomain]),
  592:     0 = wait_for_port_exit(Port1),
  593:     ok.
  594: 
  595: dyn_node_name_do(TestNode, [NameDomainStr]) ->
  596:     nonode@nohost = node(),
  597:     [] = nodes(),
  598:     [] = nodes(hidden),
  599:     NameDomain = list_to_atom(NameDomainStr),
  600:     #{started := static, name_type := dynamic, name := undefined,
  601:      name_domain := NameDomain} = net_kernel:get_state(),
  602:     net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true, [{node_type,all}]),
  603:     net_kernel:connect_node(TestNode),
  604:     [] = nodes(),
  605:     [TestNode] = nodes(hidden),
  606:     MyName = node(),
  607:     false = (MyName =:= undefined),
  608:     false = (MyName =:= nonode@nohost),
  609:     #{started := static, name_type := dynamic, name := MyName,
  610:       name_domain := NameDomain} = net_kernel:get_state(),
  611:     check([MyName], rpc:call(TestNode, erlang, nodes, [hidden])),
  612: 
  613:     {nodeup, MyName, [{node_type, visible}]} = receive_any(),
  614:     {nodeup, TestNode, [{node_type, hidden}]} = receive_any(),
  615: 
  616:     true = net_kernel:disconnect(TestNode),
  617: 
  618:     %% We don't know the order of these nodedown messages. Often
  619:     %% nodedown from the connection comes first, but not always...
  620: 
  621:     NodedownMsgsA = lists:sort([{nodedown, TestNode, [{node_type, hidden}]},
  622:                                 {nodedown, MyName, [{node_type, visible}]}]),
  623:     NodedownMsgA1 = receive_any(),
  624:     NodedownMsgA2 = receive_any(),
  625:     NodedownMsgsA = lists:sort([NodedownMsgA1, NodedownMsgA2]),
  626: 
  627:     [] = nodes(hidden),
  628:     nonode@nohost = node(),
  629:     #{started := static, name_type := dynamic, name := undefined,
  630:       name_domain := NameDomain} = net_kernel:get_state(),
  631: 
  632:     net_kernel:connect_node(TestNode),
  633:     [] = nodes(),
  634:     [TestNode] = nodes(hidden),
  635:     MyName = node(),
  636:     #{started := static, name_type := dynamic, name := MyName,
  637:       name_domain := NameDomain} = net_kernel:get_state(),
  638: 
  639:     check([MyName], rpc:call(TestNode, erlang, nodes, [hidden])),
  640: 
  641:     {nodeup, MyName, [{node_type, visible}]} = receive_any(),
  642:     {nodeup, TestNode, [{node_type, hidden}]} = receive_any(),
  643: 
  644:     true = rpc:cast(TestNode, net_kernel, disconnect, [MyName]),
  645: 
  646:     %% We don't know the order of these nodedown messages. Often
  647:     %% nodedown from the connection comes first, but not always...
  648: 
  649:     NodedownMsgsB = lists:sort([{nodedown, TestNode, [{node_type, hidden}]},
  650:                                 {nodedown, MyName, [{node_type, visible}]}]),
  651:     NodedownMsgB1 = receive_any(),
  652:     NodedownMsgB2 = receive_any(),
  653:     NodedownMsgsB = lists:sort([NodedownMsgB1, NodedownMsgB2]),
  654: 
  655:     [] = nodes(hidden),
  656:     nonode@nohost = node(),
  657:     #{started := static, name_type := dynamic, name := undefined,
  658:       name_domain := NameDomain} = net_kernel:get_state(),
  659:     ok.
  660: 
  661: check(X, X) -> ok.
  662: 
  663: setopts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  664:     run_dist_configs(fun setopts/2, Config).
  665: 
  666: setopts(DCfg, _Config) ->
  667:     register(setopts_regname, self()),
  668:     [N1,N2,N3,N4,N5] = get_nodenames(5, setopts),
  669: 
  670:     {_N1F,Port1} = start_node_unconnected(DCfg, N1, ?MODULE, run_remote_test,
  671: 					["setopts_do", atom_to_list(node()), "1", "ping"]),
  672:     0 = wait_for_port_exit(Port1),
  673: 
  674:     {_N2F,Port2} = start_node_unconnected(DCfg, N2, ?MODULE, run_remote_test,
  675: 				 ["setopts_do", atom_to_list(node()), "2", "ping"]),
  676:     0 = wait_for_port_exit(Port2),
  677: 
  678:     {ok, LSock} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{packet,2}, {active,false}]),
  679:     {ok, LTcpPort} = inet:port(LSock),
  680: 
  681:     {N3F,Port3} = start_node_unconnected(DCfg, N3, ?MODULE, run_remote_test,
  682: 					["setopts_do", atom_to_list(node()),
  683: 					 "1", integer_to_list(LTcpPort)]),
  684:     wait_and_connect(LSock, N3F, Port3),
  685:     0 = wait_for_port_exit(Port3),
  686: 
  687:     {N4F,Port4} = start_node_unconnected(DCfg, N4, ?MODULE, run_remote_test,
  688: 					["setopts_do", atom_to_list(node()),
  689: 					 "2", integer_to_list(LTcpPort)]),
  690:     wait_and_connect(LSock, N4F, Port4),
  691:     0 = wait_for_port_exit(Port4),
  692: 
  693:     %% net_kernel:setopts(new, _) used to be able to produce a deadlock
  694:     %% in net_kernel. GH-6129/OTP-18198
  695:     {N5F,Port5} = start_node_unconnected(DCfg, N5, ?MODULE, run_remote_test,
  696: 					["setopts_deadlock_test", atom_to_list(node()),
  697: 					 integer_to_list(LTcpPort)]),
  698:     wait_and_connect(LSock, N5F, Port5),
  699:     repeat(fun () ->
  700:                    receive after 10 -> ok end,
  701:                    erlang:disconnect_node(N5F),
  702:                    WD = spawn_link(fun () ->
  703:                                            receive after 2000 -> ok end,
  704:                                            exit({net_kernel_probably_deadlocked, N5F})
  705:                                    end),
  706:                    pong = net_adm:ping(N5F),
  707:                    unlink(WD),
  708:                    exit(WD, kill),
  709:                    false = is_process_alive(WD)
  710:            end,
  711:            200),
  712:     try
  713:         erpc:call(N5F, erlang, halt, [])
  714:     catch
  715:         error:{erpc,noconnection} -> ok
  716:     end,
  717:     0 = wait_for_port_exit(Port5),
  718: 
  719:     unregister(setopts_regname),
  720:     ok.
  721: 
  722: wait_and_connect(LSock, NodeName, NodePort) ->
  723:     {ok, Sock} = gen_tcp:accept(LSock),
  724:     {ok, "Connect please"} = gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0),
  725:     flush_from_port(NodePort),
  726:     pong = net_adm:ping(NodeName),
  727:     gen_tcp:send(Sock, "Connect done"),
  728:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  729: 
  730: 
  731: flush_from_port(Port) ->
  732:     flush_from_port(Port, 10).
  733: 
  734: flush_from_port(Port, Timeout) ->
  735:     receive
  736: 	{Port,{data,String}} ->
  737: 	    io:format("~p: ~s\n", [Port, String]),
  738: 	    flush_from_port(Port, Timeout)
  739:     after Timeout ->
  740: 	    timeout
  741:     end.
  742: 
  743: wait_for_port_exit(Port) ->
  744:     case (receive M -> M end) of
  745: 	{Port,{exit_status,Status}} ->
  746: 	    Status;
  747: 	{Port,{data,String}} ->
  748: 	    io:format("~p: ~s\n", [Port, String]),
  749: 	    wait_for_port_exit(Port)
  750:     end.
  751: 
  752: run_remote_test([FuncStr, TestNodeStr | Args]) ->
  753:     Status = try
  754: 	io:format("Node ~p started~n", [node()]),
  755: 	TestNode = list_to_atom(TestNodeStr),
  756: 	io:format("Node ~p spawning function ~p~n", [node(), FuncStr]),
  757: 	{Pid,Ref} = spawn_monitor(?MODULE, list_to_atom(FuncStr), [TestNode, Args]),
  758: 	io:format("Node ~p waiting for function ~p~n", [node(), FuncStr]),
  759: 	receive
  760: 	    {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, normal} ->
  761: 		0;
  762: 	    Other ->
  763: 		io:format("Node ~p got unexpected msg: ~p\n",[node(), Other]),
  764: 		1
  765: 	end
  766:     catch
  767: 	C:E:S ->
  768: 	    io:format("Node ~p got EXCEPTION ~p:~p\nat ~p\n",
  769: 		      [node(), C, E, S]),
  770: 	    2
  771:     end,
  772:     io:format("Node ~p doing halt(~p).\n",[node(), Status]),
  773:     erlang:halt(Status).
  774: 
  775: % Do the actual test on the remote node
  776: setopts_do(TestNode, [OptNr, ConnectData]) ->
  777:     [] = nodes(),
  778:     {Opt, Val} = opt_from_nr(OptNr),
  779:     ok = net_kernel:setopts(new, [{Opt, Val}]),
  780: 
  781:     [] = nodes(),
  782:     {error, noconnection} = net_kernel:getopts(TestNode, [Opt]),
  783: 
  784:     case ConnectData of
  785: 	"ping" ->  % We connect
  786: 	    net_adm:ping(TestNode);
  787: 	TcpPort -> % Other connect
  788: 	    {ok, Sock} = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", list_to_integer(TcpPort),
  789: 					 [{active,false},{packet,2}]),
  790: 	    ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, "Connect please"),
  791: 	    {ok, "Connect done"} = gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0),
  792: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock)
  793:     end,
  794:     [TestNode] = nodes(),
  795:     {ok, [{Opt,Val}]} = net_kernel:getopts(TestNode, [Opt]),
  796:     {error, noconnection} = net_kernel:getopts('pixie@fairyland', [Opt]),
  797: 
  798:     NewVal = change_val(Val),
  799:     ok = net_kernel:setopts(TestNode, [{Opt, NewVal}]),
  800:     {ok, [{Opt,NewVal}]} = net_kernel:getopts(TestNode, [Opt]),
  801: 
  802:     ok = net_kernel:setopts(TestNode, [{Opt, Val}]),
  803:     {ok, [{Opt,Val}]} = net_kernel:getopts(TestNode, [Opt]),
  804: 
  805:     ok.
  806: 
  807: setopts_deadlock_test(_TestNode, [TcpPort]) ->
  808:     {ok, Sock} = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", list_to_integer(TcpPort),
  809:                                  [{active,false},{packet,2}]),
  810:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, "Connect please"),
  811:     {ok, "Connect done"} = gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0),
  812:     gen_tcp:close(Sock),
  813:     setopts_new_loop().
  814:     
  815: setopts_new_loop() ->
  816:     ok = net_kernel:setopts(new, [{nodelay, true}]),
  817:     receive after 10 -> ok end,
  818:     setopts_new_loop().
  819:     
  820: opt_from_nr("1") -> {nodelay, true};
  821: opt_from_nr("2") -> {nodelay, false}.
  822: 
  823: change_val(true)  -> false;
  824: change_val(false) -> true.
  825: 
  826: 
  827: start_node_unconnected(DCfg, Name, Mod, Func, Args) ->
  828:     start_node_unconnected(DCfg, Name, erlang:get_cookie(), Mod, Func, Args).
  829: 
  830: start_node_unconnected(DCfg, Name, Cookie, Mod, Func, Args) ->
  831:     FullName = full_node_name(Name),
  832:     CmdLine =
  833:         mk_node_cmdline(DCfg, Name, Cookie, Mod, Func, Args),
  834:     io:format("Starting node ~p: ~s~n", [FullName, CmdLine]),
  835:     case open_port({spawn, CmdLine}, [exit_status]) of
  836: 	Port when is_port(Port) ->
  837: 	    {FullName, Port};
  838: 	Error ->
  839: 	    exit({failed_to_start_node, FullName, Error})
  840:     end.
  841: 
  842: full_node_name(PreName) when is_atom(PreName) ->
  843:     full_node_name(atom_to_list(PreName));
  844: full_node_name(PreNameL) when is_list(PreNameL) ->
  845:     HostSuffix = lists:dropwhile(fun ($@) -> false; (_) -> true end,
  846: 				 atom_to_list(node())),
  847:     list_to_atom(PreNameL ++ HostSuffix).
  848: 
  849: mk_node_cmdline(DCfg, Name, Cookie, Mod, Func, Args) ->
  850:     Static = "-noinput",
  851:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  852:     Prog = case catch init:get_argument(progname) of
  853: 	       {ok,[[P]]} -> P;
  854: 	       _ -> exit(no_progname_argument_found)
  855: 	   end,
  856:     NameSw = case net_kernel:longnames() of
  857: 		 false -> "-sname ";
  858: 		 true -> "-name ";
  859: 		 _ -> exit(not_distributed_node)
  860: 	     end,
  861:     {ok, Pwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  862:     NameStr = atom_to_list(Name),
  863:     Prog ++ " "
  864: 	++ Static ++ " "
  865: 	++ NameSw ++ " " ++ NameStr
  866:         ++ " " ++ DCfg
  867: 	++ " -pa " ++ Pa
  868: 	++ " -env ERL_CRASH_DUMP " ++ Pwd ++ "/erl_crash_dump." ++ NameStr
  869: 	++ " -setcookie " ++ atom_to_list(Cookie)
  870: 	++ " -run " ++ atom_to_list(Mod) ++ " " ++ atom_to_list(Func)
  871: 	++ " " ++ string:join(Args, " ").
  872: 
  873: 
  874: %% OTP-4255.
  875: tick_change(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  876:     run_dist_configs(fun tick_change/2, Config).
  877: 
  878: tick_change(DCfg, _Config) ->
  879:     %%
  880:     %% This test case use disabled "connect all" so that
  881:     %% global wont interfere...
  882:     %%
  883:     [BN, CN] = get_nodenames(2, tick_change),
  884:     DefaultTT = net_kernel:get_net_ticktime(),
  885:     unchanged = net_kernel:set_net_ticktime(DefaultTT, 60),
  886:     case DefaultTT of
  887: 	I when is_integer(I) -> ok;
  888: 	_                 -> ct:fail(DefaultTT)
  889:     end,
  890: 
  891:     %% In case other nodes are connected
  892:     case nodes(connected) of
  893: 	[] -> net_kernel:set_net_ticktime(10, 0);
  894: 	_ ->  rpc:multicall(nodes([this, connected]), net_kernel,
  895: 			    set_net_ticktime, [10, 5])
  896:     end,
  897: 
  898:     wait_until(fun () -> 10 == net_kernel:get_net_ticktime() end),
  899:     {ok, B} = start_node(DCfg, BN, "-kernel net_ticktime 10 -connect_all false"),
  900:     {ok, C} = start_node(DCfg, CN, "-kernel net_ticktime 10 -hidden"),
  901: 
  902:     OTE = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  903:     case catch begin
  904: 		   run_tick_change_test(DCfg, B, C, 10, 1),
  905: 		   run_tick_change_test(DCfg, B, C, 1, 10)
  906: 	       end of
  907: 	{'EXIT', Reason} ->
  908: 	    stop_node(B),
  909: 	    stop_node(C),
  910: 	    %% In case other nodes are connected
  911: 	    case nodes(connected) of
  912: 		[] -> net_kernel:set_net_ticktime(DefaultTT, 0);
  913: 		_ ->  rpc:multicall(nodes([this, connected]), net_kernel,
  914: 				    set_net_ticktime, [DefaultTT, 10])
  915: 	    end,
  916: 	    wait_until(fun () ->
  917: 			       DefaultTT == net_kernel:get_net_ticktime()
  918: 		       end),
  919: 	    process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
  920: 	    ct:fail(Reason);
  921: 	_ ->
  922: 	    ok
  923:     end,
  924:     process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
  925:     stop_node(B),
  926:     stop_node(C),
  927: 
  928:     %% In case other nodes are connected
  929:     case nodes(connected) of
  930: 	[] -> net_kernel:set_net_ticktime(DefaultTT, 0);
  931: 	_ ->  rpc:multicall(nodes([this, connected]), net_kernel,
  932: 			    set_net_ticktime, [DefaultTT, 5])
  933:     end,
  934: 
  935:     wait_until(fun () -> DefaultTT == net_kernel:get_net_ticktime() end),
  936:     ok.
  937: 
  938: 
  939: wait_for_nodedowns(Tester, Ref) ->
  940:     receive
  941: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  942: 	    io:format("~p~n", [{node(), {nodedown, Node}}]),
  943: 	    Tester ! {Ref, {node(), {nodedown, Node}}}
  944:     end,
  945:     wait_for_nodedowns(Tester, Ref).
  946: 
  947: run_tick_change_test(DCfg, B, C, PrevTT, TT) ->
  948:     [DN, EN] = get_nodenames(2, tick_change),
  949: 
  950:     Tester = self(),
  951:     Ref = make_ref(),
  952:     MonitorNodes = fun (Nodes) ->
  953: 			   lists:foreach(
  954: 			     fun (N) ->
  955: 				     monitor_node(N,true)
  956: 			     end,
  957: 			     Nodes),
  958: 			   wait_for_nodedowns(Tester, Ref)
  959: 		   end,
  960: 
  961:     {ok, D} = start_node(DCfg, DN, "-connect_all false -kernel net_ticktime "
  962: 			 ++ integer_to_list(PrevTT)),
  963: 
  964:     NMA = spawn_link(fun () -> MonitorNodes([B, C, D]) end),
  965:     NMB = spawn_link(B, fun () -> MonitorNodes([node(), C, D]) end),
  966:     NMC = spawn_link(C, fun () -> MonitorNodes([node(), B, D]) end),
  967: 
  968:     MaxTT = case PrevTT > TT of
  969: 		true  -> PrevTT;
  970: 		false -> TT
  971: 	    end,
  972: 
  973:     CheckResult = make_ref(),
  974:     spawn_link(fun () ->
  975: 		       receive
  976: 		       after (25 + MaxTT)*1000 ->
  977: 			       Tester ! CheckResult
  978: 		       end
  979: 	       end),
  980: 
  981:     %% In case other nodes than these are connected
  982:     case nodes(connected) -- [B, C, D] of
  983: 	[] -> ok;
  984: 	OtherNodes -> rpc:multicall(OtherNodes, net_kernel,
  985: 				    set_net_ticktime, [TT, 20])
  986:     end,
  987: 
  988:     change_initiated = net_kernel:set_net_ticktime(TT,20),
  989:     {ongoing_change_to,_} = net_kernel:set_net_ticktime(TT,20),
  990:     sleep(3),
  991:     change_initiated = rpc:call(B,net_kernel,set_net_ticktime,[TT,15]),
  992:     sleep(7),
  993:     change_initiated = rpc:call(C,net_kernel,set_net_ticktime,[TT,10]),
  994: 
  995:     {ok, E} = start_node(DCfg, EN, "-connect_all false -kernel net_ticktime "
  996: 			 ++ integer_to_list(TT)),
  997:     NME  = spawn_link(E, fun () -> MonitorNodes([node(), B, C, D]) end),
  998:     NMA2 = spawn_link(fun () -> MonitorNodes([E]) end),
  999:     NMB2 = spawn_link(B, fun () -> MonitorNodes([E]) end),
 1000:     NMC2 = spawn_link(C, fun () -> MonitorNodes([E]) end),
 1001: 
 1002:     receive CheckResult -> ok end,
 1003: 
 1004:     unlink(NMA),  exit(NMA, kill),
 1005:     unlink(NMB),  exit(NMB, kill),
 1006:     unlink(NMC),  exit(NMC, kill),
 1007:     unlink(NME),  exit(NME, kill),
 1008:     unlink(NMA2), exit(NMA2, kill),
 1009:     unlink(NMB2), exit(NMB2, kill),
 1010:     unlink(NMC2), exit(NMC2, kill),
 1011: 
 1012:     %% The node not changing ticktime should have been disconnected from the
 1013:     %% other nodes
 1014:     receive {Ref, {Node, {nodedown, D}}} when Node == node() -> ok
 1015:     after 0 -> exit({?LINE, no_nodedown})
 1016:     end,
 1017:     receive {Ref, {B, {nodedown, D}}} -> ok
 1018:     after 0 -> exit({?LINE, no_nodedown})
 1019:     end,
 1020:     receive {Ref, {C, {nodedown, D}}} -> ok
 1021:     after 0 -> exit({?LINE, no_nodedown})
 1022:     end,
 1023:     receive {Ref, {E, {nodedown, D}}} -> ok
 1024:     after 0 -> exit({?LINE, no_nodedown})
 1025:     end,
 1026: 
 1027:     %% No other connections should have been broken
 1028:     receive
 1029: 	{Ref, Reason} ->
 1030: 	    stop_node(E),
 1031: 	    exit({?LINE, Reason});
 1032: 	{'EXIT', Pid, Reason} when Pid == NMA;
 1033: 				   Pid == NMB;
 1034: 				   Pid == NMC;
 1035: 				   Pid == NME;
 1036: 				   Pid == NMA2;
 1037: 				   Pid == NMB2;
 1038: 				   Pid == NMC2 ->
 1039: 	    stop_node(E),
 1040: 
 1041: 	    exit({?LINE, {node(Pid), Reason}})
 1042:     after 0 ->
 1043: 	    TT = net_kernel:get_net_ticktime(),
 1044: 	    TT = rpc:call(B, net_kernel, get_net_ticktime, []),
 1045: 	    TT = rpc:call(C, net_kernel, get_net_ticktime, []),
 1046: 	    TT = rpc:call(E, net_kernel, get_net_ticktime, []),
 1047: 	    stop_node(E),
 1048: 	    ok
 1049:     end.
 1050: 
 1051: %%
 1052: %% Basic tests of hidden node.
 1053: %%
 1054: %% Basic test of hidden node.
 1055: hidden_node(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1056:     run_dist_configs(fun hidden_node/2, Config).
 1057: 
 1058: hidden_node(DCfg, Config) ->
 1059:     hidden_node(DCfg, "-hidden", Config),
 1060:     hidden_node(DCfg, "-hidden -hidden", Config),
 1061:     hidden_node(DCfg, "-hidden true -hidden true", Config),
 1062:     ok.
 1063: 
 1064: hidden_node(DCfg, HArgs, _Config) ->
 1065:     ct:pal("--- Hidden argument(s): ~s~n", [HArgs]),
 1066:     {ok, V} = start_node(DCfg, visible_node),
 1067:     VMN = start_monitor_nodes_proc(V),
 1068:     {ok, H} = start_node(DCfg, hidden_node, HArgs),
 1069:     %% Connect visible_node -> hidden_node
 1070:     connect_nodes(V, H),
 1071:     test_nodes(V, H),
 1072:     stop_node(H),
 1073:     sleep(5),
 1074:     check_monitor_nodes_res(VMN, H),
 1075:     stop_node(V),
 1076:     {ok, H} = start_node(DCfg, hidden_node, HArgs),
 1077:     HMN = start_monitor_nodes_proc(H),
 1078:     {ok, V} = start_node(DCfg, visible_node),
 1079:     %% Connect hidden_node -> visible_node
 1080:     connect_nodes(H, V),
 1081:     test_nodes(V, H),
 1082:     stop_node(V),
 1083:     sleep(5),
 1084:     check_monitor_nodes_res(HMN, V),
 1085:     stop_node(H),
 1086:     ok.
 1087: 
 1088: connect_nodes(A, B) ->
 1089:     %% Check that they haven't already connected.
 1090:     false = lists:member(A, rpc:call(B, erlang, nodes, [connected])),
 1091:     false = lists:member(B, rpc:call(A, erlang, nodes, [connected])),
 1092:     %% Connect them.
 1093:     pong = rpc:call(A, net_adm, ping, [B]).
 1094: 
 1095: 
 1096: test_nodes(V, H) ->
 1097:     %% No nodes should be visible on hidden_node
 1098:     [] = rpc:call(H, erlang, nodes, []),
 1099:     %% visible_node should be hidden on hidden_node
 1100:     true = lists:member(V, rpc:call(H, erlang, nodes, [hidden])),
 1101:     %% hidden_node node shouldn't be visible on visible_node
 1102:     false = lists:member(H, rpc:call(V, erlang, nodes, [])),
 1103:     %% hidden_node should be hidden on visible_node
 1104:     true = lists:member(H, rpc:call(V, erlang, nodes, [hidden])).
 1105: 
 1106: mn_loop(MNs) ->
 1107:     receive
 1108: 	{nodeup, N} ->
 1109: 	    mn_loop([{nodeup, N}|MNs]);
 1110: 	{nodedown, N} ->
 1111: 	    mn_loop([{nodedown, N}|MNs]);
 1112: 	{monitor_nodes_result, Ref, From} ->
 1113: 	    From ! {Ref, MNs};
 1114: 	_ ->
 1115: 	    mn_loop(MNs)
 1116:     end.
 1117: 
 1118: start_monitor_nodes_proc(Node) ->
 1119:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1120:     Starter = self(),
 1121:     Pid = spawn(Node,
 1122: 		fun() ->
 1123: 			net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true),
 1124: 			Starter ! Ref,
 1125: 			mn_loop([])
 1126: 		end),
 1127:     receive
 1128: 	Ref ->
 1129: 	    ok
 1130:     end,
 1131:     Pid.
 1132: 
 1133: 
 1134: check_monitor_nodes_res(Pid, Node) ->
 1135:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1136:     Pid ! {monitor_nodes_result, Ref, self()},
 1137:     receive
 1138: 	{Ref, MNs} ->
 1139: 	    false = lists:keysearch(Node, 2, MNs)
 1140:     end.
 1141: 
 1142: 
 1143: 
 1144: %% Check the kernel inet_dist_{listen,connect}_options options.
 1145: inet_dist_options_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1146:     Prio = 1,
 1147:     case gen_udp:open(0, [{priority,Prio}]) of
 1148: 	{ok,Socket} ->
 1149: 	    case inet:getopts(Socket, [priority]) of
 1150: 		{ok,[{priority,Prio}]} ->
 1151: 		    ok = gen_udp:close(Socket),
 1152: 		    do_inet_dist_options_options(Prio);
 1153: 		_ ->
 1154: 		    ok = gen_udp:close(Socket),
 1155: 		    {skip,
 1156: 		     "Can not set priority "++integer_to_list(Prio)++
 1157: 			 " on socket"}
 1158: 	    end;
 1159: 	{error,_} ->
 1160: 	    {skip, "Can not set priority on socket"}
 1161:     end.
 1162: 
 1163: do_inet_dist_options_options(Prio) ->
 1164:     PriorityString0 = "[{priority,"++integer_to_list(Prio)++"}]",
 1165:     PriorityString =
 1166: 	case os:cmd("echo [{a,1}]") of
 1167: 	    "[{a,1}]"++_ ->
 1168: 		PriorityString0;
 1169: 	    _ ->
 1170: 		%% Some shells need quoting of [{}]
 1171: 		"'"++PriorityString0++"'"
 1172: 	end,
 1173:     InetDistOptions =
 1174: 	"-hidden "
 1175: 	"-kernel inet_dist_connect_options "++PriorityString++" "
 1176: 	"-kernel inet_dist_listen_options "++PriorityString,
 1177:     {ok,Node1} =
 1178: 	start_node("", inet_dist_options_1, InetDistOptions),
 1179:     {ok,Node2} =
 1180: 	start_node("", inet_dist_options_2, InetDistOptions),
 1181:     %%
 1182:     pong =
 1183: 	rpc:call(Node1, net_adm, ping, [Node2]),
 1184:     PrioritiesNode1 =
 1185: 	rpc:call(Node1, ?MODULE, get_socket_priorities, []),
 1186:     PrioritiesNode2 =
 1187: 	rpc:call(Node2, ?MODULE, get_socket_priorities, []),
 1188:     io:format("PrioritiesNode1 = ~p", [PrioritiesNode1]),
 1189:     io:format("PrioritiesNode2 = ~p", [PrioritiesNode2]),
 1190:     Elevated = [P || P <- PrioritiesNode1, P =:= Prio],
 1191:     Elevated = [P || P <- PrioritiesNode2, P =:= Prio],
 1192:     [_|_] = Elevated,
 1193:     %%
 1194:     stop_node(Node2),
 1195:     stop_node(Node1),
 1196:     ok.
 1197: 
 1198: get_socket_priorities() ->
 1199:     [Priority ||
 1200: 	{ok,[{priority,Priority}]} <-
 1201: 	    [inet:getopts(Port, [priority]) ||
 1202: 		Port <- erlang:ports(),
 1203: 		element(2, erlang:port_info(Port, name)) =:= "tcp_inet"]].
 1204: 
 1205: 
 1206: 
 1207: %% check net_ticker_spawn_options
 1208: net_ticker_spawn_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1209:     run_dist_configs(fun net_ticker_spawn_options/2, Config).
 1210: 
 1211: net_ticker_spawn_options(DCfg, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1212:     FullsweepString0 = "[{fullsweep_after,0}]",
 1213:     FullsweepString =
 1214:         case os:cmd("echo [{a,1}]") of
 1215:             "[{a,1}]"++_ ->
 1216:                 FullsweepString0;
 1217:             _ ->
 1218:                 %% Some shells need quoting of [{}]
 1219:                 "'"++FullsweepString0++"'"
 1220:         end,
 1221:     InetDistOptions =
 1222:         "-hidden "
 1223:         "-kernel net_ticker_spawn_options "++FullsweepString,
 1224:     {ok,Node1} =
 1225:         start_node(DCfg, net_ticker_spawn_options_1, InetDistOptions),
 1226:     {ok,Node2} =
 1227:         start_node(DCfg, net_ticker_spawn_options_2, InetDistOptions),
 1228:     %%
 1229:     pong =
 1230:         erpc:call(Node1, net_adm, ping, [Node2]),
 1231:     FullsweepOptionNode1 =
 1232:         erpc:call(Node1, ?MODULE, get_net_ticker_fullsweep_option, [Node2]),
 1233:     FullsweepOptionNode2 =
 1234:         erpc:call(Node2, ?MODULE, get_net_ticker_fullsweep_option, [Node1]),
 1235:     io:format("FullsweepOptionNode1 = ~p", [FullsweepOptionNode1]),
 1236:     io:format("FullsweepOptionNode2 = ~p", [FullsweepOptionNode2]),
 1237:     0 = FullsweepOptionNode1,
 1238:     0 = FullsweepOptionNode2,
 1239:     %%
 1240:     stop_node(Node2),
 1241:     stop_node(Node1),
 1242:     ok.
 1243: 
 1244: get_net_ticker_fullsweep_option(Node) ->
 1245:     Links = case proplists:get_value(Node, erlang:system_info(dist_ctrl)) of
 1246:                 DistCtrl when is_port(DistCtrl) ->
 1247:                     {links, Ls} = erlang:port_info(DistCtrl, links),
 1248:                     Ls;
 1249:                 DistCtrl when is_pid(DistCtrl) ->
 1250:                     {links, Ls} = process_info(DistCtrl, links),
 1251:                     Ls
 1252:             end,
 1253:     Ticker = try
 1254:                  lists:foreach(
 1255:                    fun (Pid) when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1256:                            {current_stacktrace, Stk}
 1257:                                = process_info(Pid, current_stacktrace),
 1258:                            lists:foreach(
 1259:                              fun ({dist_util, con_loop, _, _}) ->
 1260:                                      throw(Pid);
 1261:                                  (_) ->
 1262:                                      ok
 1263:                              end, Stk);
 1264:                        (_) ->
 1265:                            ok
 1266:                    end, Links),
 1267:                  error(no_ticker_found)
 1268:              catch
 1269:                  throw:Pid when is_pid(Pid) -> Pid
 1270:              end,
 1271:     {garbage_collection, GCOpts} = erlang:process_info(Ticker, garbage_collection),
 1272:     proplists:get_value(fullsweep_after, GCOpts).
 1273: 
 1274: 
 1275: 
 1276: %%
 1277: %% Testcase:
 1278: %%   monitor_nodes_nodedown_reason
 1279: %%
 1280: 
 1281: monitor_nodes_nodedown_reason(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1282:     run_dist_configs(fun monitor_nodes_nodedown_reason/2, Config).
 1283: 
 1284: monitor_nodes_nodedown_reason(DCfg, _Config) ->
 1285:     MonNodeState = monitor_node_state(),
 1286:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true),
 1287:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true, [nodedown_reason]),
 1288: 
 1289:     Names = get_numbered_nodenames(5, node),
 1290:     [NN1, NN2, NN3, NN4, NN5] = Names,
 1291: 
 1292:     {ok, N1} = start_node(DCfg, NN1, "-connect_all false"),
 1293:     {ok, N2} = start_node(DCfg, NN2, "-connect_all false"),
 1294:     {ok, N3} = start_node(DCfg, NN3, "-connect_all false"),
 1295:     {ok, N4} = start_node(DCfg, NN4, "-hidden"),
 1296: 
 1297:     receive {nodeup, N1} -> ok end,
 1298:     receive {nodeup, N2} -> ok end,
 1299:     receive {nodeup, N3} -> ok end,
 1300: 
 1301:     receive {nodeup, N1, []} -> ok end,
 1302:     receive {nodeup, N2, []} -> ok end,
 1303:     receive {nodeup, N3, []} -> ok end,
 1304: 
 1305:     stop_node(N1),
 1306:     stop_node(N4),
 1307:     true = net_kernel:disconnect(N2),
 1308:     TickTime = net_kernel:get_net_ticktime(),
 1309:     SleepTime = TickTime + (TickTime div 2),
 1310:     spawn(N3, fun () ->
 1311: 		      block_emu(SleepTime*1000),
 1312: 		      halt()
 1313: 	      end),
 1314: 
 1315:     receive {nodedown, N1} -> ok end,
 1316:     receive {nodedown, N2} -> ok end,
 1317:     receive {nodedown, N3} -> ok end,
 1318: 
 1319:     receive {nodedown, N1, [{nodedown_reason, R1}]} -> connection_closed = R1 end,
 1320:     receive {nodedown, N2, [{nodedown_reason, R2}]} -> disconnect = R2 end,
 1321:     receive {nodedown, N3, [{nodedown_reason, R3}]} -> net_tick_timeout = R3 end,
 1322: 
 1323:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(false, [nodedown_reason]),
 1324: 
 1325:     {ok, N5} = start_node(DCfg, NN5),
 1326:     stop_node(N5),
 1327: 
 1328:     receive {nodeup, N5} -> ok end,
 1329:     receive {nodedown, N5} -> ok end,
 1330:     print_my_messages(),
 1331:     ok = check_no_nodedown_nodeup(1000),
 1332:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(false),
 1333:     MonNodeState = monitor_node_state(),
 1334:     ok.
 1335: 
 1336: 
 1337: monitor_nodes_complex_nodedown_reason(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1338:     run_dist_configs(fun monitor_nodes_complex_nodedown_reason/2, Config).
 1339: 
 1340: monitor_nodes_complex_nodedown_reason(DCfg, _Config) ->
 1341:     MonNodeState = monitor_node_state(),
 1342:     Me = self(),
 1343:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true, [nodedown_reason]),
 1344:     [Name] = get_nodenames(1, monitor_nodes_complex_nodedown_reason),
 1345:     {ok, Node} = start_node(DCfg, Name, ""),
 1346:     Pid = spawn(Node,
 1347: 		fun() ->
 1348: 			Me ! {stuff,
 1349: 			      self(),
 1350: 			      [make_ref(),
 1351: 			       {processes(), erlang:ports()}]}
 1352: 		end),
 1353:     receive {nodeup, Node, []} -> ok end,
 1354:     {ok, NodeInfo} = net_kernel:node_info(Node),
 1355:     {value,{owner, Owner}} = lists:keysearch(owner, 1, NodeInfo),
 1356:     ComplexTerm = receive {stuff, Pid, _} = Msg ->
 1357: 			  {Msg, term_to_binary(Msg)}
 1358: 		  end,
 1359:     exit(Owner, ComplexTerm),
 1360:     receive
 1361: 	{nodedown, Node, [{nodedown_reason, NodeDownReason}]} ->
 1362: 	    ok
 1363:     end,
 1364:     %% If the complex nodedown_reason messed something up garbage collections
 1365:     %% are likely to dump core
 1366:     garbage_collect(),
 1367:     garbage_collect(),
 1368:     garbage_collect(),
 1369:     ComplexTerm = NodeDownReason,
 1370:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(false, [nodedown_reason]),
 1371:     no_msgs(),
 1372:     MonNodeState = monitor_node_state(),
 1373:     ok.
 1374: 
 1375:

 1384:     run_dist_configs(fun monitor_nodes_node_type/2, Config).
 1385: 
 1386: monitor_nodes_node_type(DCfg, _Config) ->
 1387:     MonNodeState = monitor_node_state(),
 1388:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true),
 1389:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true, [{node_type, all}]),
 1390:     Names = get_numbered_nodenames(9, node),
 1391:     [NN1, NN2, NN3, NN4, NN5, NN6, NN7, NN8, NN9] = Names,
 1392: 
 1393:     {ok, N1} = start_node(DCfg, NN1),
 1394:     {ok, N2} = start_node(DCfg, NN2),
 1395:     {ok, N3} = start_node(DCfg, NN3, "-hidden"),
 1396:     {ok, N4} = start_node(DCfg, NN4, "-hidden"),
 1397: 
 1398:     receive {nodeup, N1} -> ok end,
 1399:     receive {nodeup, N2} -> ok end,
 1400: 
 1401:     receive {nodeup, N1, [{node_type, visible}]} -> ok end,
 1402:     receive {nodeup, N2, [{node_type, visible}]} -> ok end,
 1403:     receive {nodeup, N3, [{node_type, hidden}]} -> ok end,
 1404:     receive {nodeup, N4, [{node_type, hidden}]} -> ok end,
 1405: 
 1406:     stop_node(N1),
 1407:     stop_node(N2),
 1408:     stop_node(N3),
 1409:     stop_node(N4),
 1410: 
 1411:     receive {nodedown, N1} -> ok end,
 1412:     receive {nodedown, N2} -> ok end,
 1413: 
 1414:     receive {nodedown, N1, [{node_type, visible}]} -> ok end,
 1415:     receive {nodedown, N2, [{node_type, visible}]} -> ok end,
 1416:     receive {nodedown, N3, [{node_type, hidden}]} -> ok end,
 1417:     receive {nodedown, N4, [{node_type, hidden}]} -> ok end,
 1418: 
 1419:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(false, [{node_type, all}]),
 1420:     {ok, N5} = start_node(DCfg, NN5),
 1421: 
 1422:     receive {nodeup, N5} -> ok end,
 1423:     stop_node(N5),
 1424:     receive {nodedown, N5} -> ok end,
 1425: 
 1426:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true, [{node_type, hidden}]),
 1427:     {ok, N6} = start_node(DCfg, NN6),
 1428:     {ok, N7} = start_node(DCfg, NN7, "-hidden"),
 1429: 
 1430: 
 1431:     receive {nodeup, N6} -> ok end,
 1432:     receive {nodeup, N7, [{node_type, hidden}]} -> ok end,
 1433:     stop_node(N6),
 1434:     stop_node(N7),
 1435: 
 1436:     receive {nodedown, N6} -> ok end,
 1437:     receive {nodedown, N7, [{node_type, hidden}]} -> ok end,
 1438: 
 1439:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true, [{node_type, visible}]),
 1440:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(false, [{node_type, hidden}]),
 1441:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(false),
 1442: 
 1443:     {ok, N8} = start_node(DCfg, NN8),
 1444:     {ok, N9} = start_node(DCfg, NN9, "-hidden"),
 1445: 
 1446:     receive {nodeup, N8, [{node_type, visible}]} -> ok end,
 1447:     stop_node(N8),
 1448:     stop_node(N9),
 1449: 
 1450:     receive {nodedown, N8, [{node_type, visible}]} -> ok end,
 1451:     print_my_messages(),
 1452:     ok = check_no_nodedown_nodeup(1000),
 1453:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(false, [{node_type, visible}]),
 1454:     MonNodeState = monitor_node_state(),
 1455:     ok.
